176.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport, which also provides electricity connection along with the bus transportation service in Mumbai, has decided to install 10 lakh smart meters to tackle electricity reading errors. The smart meters will be enabled with 4G and 5G SIM cards. Consumers can track their usage and recharge them similar to that of mobile phones, officials said.

177.title: 'Godman' allegedly rapes woman on pretext of curing her son in Pune
177.article_body: Pune police have arrested a 60-year-old self-proclaimed godman for allegedly raping a 36-year-old woman. The accused had done so under the pretext of performing rituals to cure her son's physical disability and improve the family's financial condition. The incident occurred when the accused went to the woman's house and reportedly forced her to disrobe under the guise of "a spell".

178.title: UPSC Civil Services Exam 2021 final results declared, Shruti Sharma tops exam
178.article_body: The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has declared the final results of Civil Services Examination, 2021. Shruti Sharma has topped the examination, while Ankita Agarwal and Gamini Singla secured the second and the third rank, respectively. A total number of 685 candidates have been recommended for appointment, according to an official press release.

179.title: My son left forever due to govt's failure, his mother asks when he'll return: Sidhu's father
179.article_body: Singer Sidhu Moosewala's father Balkaur Singh has written a letter to Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann after his son's murder. He wrote, "Due to failures of your government, my son left us forever." He added, "Shubhdeep's mother asks me where is her son and when will he return home. What answer should I give her? I hope I will get justice."

180.title: Key accused in Assam police station fire 'accidentally' run over by escort vehicle, dies
180.article_body: The man, Ashikul Islam, who was accused of inciting a mob to set the police station in Assam's Nagaon on fire was killed as an escort vehicle "accidentally" ran over him on Monday, police said. Reports said he was trying to run away from police custody. Three police personnel were also injured in the incident.

181.title: Absolutely devastating: Lilly Singh mourns Sidhu Moosewala's demise
181.article_body: YouTuber-comedian Lilly Singh took to Instagram to mourn the demise of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala. "Absolutely devastating and upsetting news," Lilly wrote while adding, "Through his revolutionary music, he'll live on. Beyond the care he had for his community, he created the soundtrack that made many of us feel seen, a perfect blend of hip hop, rap and folk music."

182.title: Peru to open criminal investigation into President Pedro Castillo
182.article_body: Peru's Public Ministry announced on Sunday that National Prosecutor Pablo Sanchez will open a preliminary investigation into President Pedro Castillo over alleged crimes like peddling, collusion and criminal organisation. The investigation, which was initially opened against a former minister and six congressmen, will now include Castillo due to the "seriousness" of the accusations, it said.

183.title: Cong will go with collective leadership in Gujarat polls: Mevani
183.article_body: Congress backed independent MLA Jignesh Mevani has said that the party will go with a "collective leadership" in this year's Gujarat Assembly polls. However, Mevani cleared that he is not among the contenders to become CM if Congress wins the polls. "Gujarat's people are aware of the situation...during the COVID-19, the performance of the Gujarat government was pathetic," Mevani said.

184.title: Hardik cleaned up RR's heart, heartbeat, kidney in the final: Aakash
184.article_body: Ex-India batter Aakash Chopra, speaking about GT skipper Hardik Pandya's three-wicket haul versus RR in IPL 2022 final, said, "Hardik cleaned up the heart, heartbeat and kidney." Aakash added, "The captain came to the forefront in the grand finale, when do you get to see that many times?" Hardik dismissed Sanju Samson, Jos Buttler and Shimron Hetmyer in the match.

185.title: Man accused of raping stepdaughter dies in police custody in Delhi
185.article_body: A 40-year-old man, accused of raping his stepdaughter, died in police custody in Delhi. Denying allegations of custodial assault, the police said that the man was beaten up by the locals before he was arrested and that might have caused his death. The police said they took the man to the lock-up only after the doctors had discharged him.

186.title: Punjab CM orders inquiry into Moosewala's security cut, agrees to judicial probe
186.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Monday ordered an inquiry into the decision to reduce security of singer Sidhu Moosewala. Further, Punjab government will request Chief Justice of Punjab and Haryana High Court to get the murder case inquired into by the sitting judge of the High Court, Chief Minister's Office said. This comes after Moosewala's father wrote to CM Mann.

187.title: Will sell my clothes to provide cheapest wheat flour to people: Pak PM
187.article_body: Amid a wheat shortage, Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif gave an ultimatum to the CM of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province asking him to reduce the price of a 10 kg wheat flour bag to ₹400 within the next 24 hours. Sharif said if the CM failed to do so, "I would sell my outfits and provide the cheapest wheat flour to people."

188.title: 2 terrorists killed in encounter in J&K's Pulwama
188.article_body: Two local terrorists were killed in an encounter by the security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama on Monday, said police. The encounter started in the Gundipora area on Sunday based on the inputs received from Kulgam Police. According to Kashmir Zone Police, two terrorists belonging to JeM, including the killer of Constable Reyaz Ahmad, were trapped.

189.title: It defines the law & order situation in Punjab: Kangana on Moosewala's killing
189.article_body: Kangana Ranaut took to her Instagram Stories on Monday to express grief over the demise of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, who was killed in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday. "This is a sad incident," she wrote, adding, "This incident defines the law and order situation in Punjab." Moosewala was shot dead by unidentified assailants in a village in Mansa.

190.title: Moosewala's mother criticises Punjab CM outside hospital after son's murder
190.article_body: A video of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's mother Charan Kaur criticising Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann outside the civil hospital in Mansa, where her son was declared dead, is being widely circulated on social media. Reports said that Moosewala's mother blamed Punjab government and demanded justice. Notably, Moosewala's security was reduced a day before he was shot dead.

191.title: It stared, we had nowhere to hide: Guj farmer on finding lion on house roof
191.article_body: A farmer, who found a lion on the roof of his house in Gujarat while he and his family were sleeping, said that the lion stared at his family and his cattle and that they had nowhere to hide. "We kept flashing torches at the lion but it refused to climb down the roof," the farmer added.

192.title: Drake shares pic of Sidhu Moosewala with his mother, writes 'RIP Moose'
192.article_body: Canadian rapper Drake took to his Instagram Stories to mourn the demise of Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa district on Sunday. Sharing a picture of Moosewala with his mother, Drake wrote, "RIP Moose." As per police, a member of Lawrence Bishnoi's gang has claimed responsibility for Moosewala's murder.

193.title: He was getting extortion & threat calls from Lawrence Bishnoi gang: Moosewala's father
193.article_body: Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Mansa, was "getting extortion and threat to life calls from Lawrence Bishnoi gang and others", according to an FIR filed by his father Balkaur Singh. Moosewala had bought a bulletproof Toyota Fortuner in the wake of these threats but left home without his SUV and gunmen on Sunday, the FIR added.

194.title: Somebody trying to test new govt's red lines: Manish Tewari on Moosewala's killing
194.article_body: Following Punjabi Singer Sidhu Moosewala's killing, Congress leader Manish Tewari said it's obvious that somebody is trying to test the red lines of the new government. "Since the new government was formed in Punjab, there have been a series of unfortunate incidents...If peace of a border state gets disturbed then it can have various implications," Tewari added.

195.title: We'll meet Shah if we don't get justice: Punjab Cong chief on Moosewala's killing
195.article_body: After Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead in Mansa, state Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja Warring said the party will meet Union Home Minister Amit Shah if they don't get justice. "We will go to high court and will meet the Governor," Warring added. "It needs to be investigated under a sitting judge and the NIA," he stated.

196.title: Sidhu Moosewala's family seeks CBI and NIA probe into his murder
196.article_body: Late singer Sidhu Moosewala's family has sought a CBI and NIA probe into his murder. His father wrote to Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, saying that a CBI and NIA probe is must. The family has also sought action against officials who leaked the list of individuals who were stripped of security cover. Moosewala was shot dead on Sunday.

197.title: Parking rates reduced at Noida's Sector 18 market, starts from ₹10
197.article_body: After constant demands from traders and customers, the Noida Authority has reduced the parking rates in Noida's Sector 18 market. The reduced rates will be implemented on both, surface and multi-level parking lots. Four-wheelers and two-wheelers will now be charged ₹20 and ₹10 respectively for 30 minutes while for up to four hours, it will be ₹50 and ₹25 respectively.

198.title: Bad day for music industry: Diljit Dosanjh on Sidhu Moosewala's death
198.article_body: Singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh reacted to singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's demise. Taking to Twitter, Diljit wrote, "The boy had a lot of talent. I never met him but his hard work spoke for him. This is hard for the parents." "It's a very bad day for the music industry," he added. Sidhu was killed in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday.

199.title: Daughter refuses to believe I voiced Maui, says 'you're The Rock': Dwayne
199.article_body: Hollywood actor Dwayne Johnson has shared that his four-year-old daughter Tiana "refuses to believe" that he had voiced a character from one of her favourite Disney films. "She still refuses to believe her daddy is...MAUI from one of her favourites, MOANA! She always says, 'Daddy, you're not Maui, you're The Rock'," he added. The animated movie was released in 2016.

200.title: RR need a batter who's a little more consistent than Riyan: Manjrekar
200.article_body: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said RR, who lost IPL 2022 final to GT, currently have 80-90 per cent of the "right team" for the next IPL season. Manjrekar added, "They need a batter who's a little more consistent than...maybe Riyan Parag and can also bowl two-three overs." Riyan scored 183 runs in 14 innings in IPL 2022.

201.title: Tata Motors signs MoU with Gujarat govt for acquisition of Ford's Sanand plant
201.article_body: Tata Motors has signed an MoU with the Gujarat government for the potential acquisition of Ford India's Sanand plant, it said in a regulatory filing. The agreement includes a transfer of Ford India's land, buildings, vehicle manufacturing plant, machinery and transfer of all eligible employees. As per a report, Tata Motors would pay $100-150 million for the plant.

202.title: 1 killed, 7 wounded in shooting at Oklahoma festival in US
202.article_body: A 39-year-old woman was killed and seven other people were wounded in a shooting that took place at an outdoor festival in US' Oklahoma. "Bullets were literally flying everywhere," said an eyewitness. According to the witnesses, the shooting was preceded by an argument. A 26-year-old man has been taken into custody, said the authorities.

203.title: Kamal meets Rajinikanth ahead of Vikram's release, director shares pics
203.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan met actor Rajinikanth ahead of the release of his film 'Vikram'. The film's director Lokesh Kanagaraj and producer R Mahendran also met Rajinikanth. Lokesh, taking to Twitter, shared pictures of the meeting and wrote, "Thank you Kamal sir! Rajinikanth sir! What a friendship! Inspiring." Actors Vijay Sethupathi and Fahadh Faasil also feature in the film.

204.title: Zelenskyy fires Kharkiv security chief for 'not working to defend city
204.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday said that he dismissed the head of Security Service in Kharkiv for "not working to defend the city from...first days of a full-scale war, but thinking only of himself". However, he praised the army, police, city's Mayor and regional state administration for "working very effectively". Zelenskyy had visited the city on the same day.

205.title: 14 bodies found at Nepal plane crash site, official says 'Suspect all 22 died'
205.article_body: Fourteen bodies have been recovered so far in Mustang, Nepal where Tara Air plane carrying 22 people including four Indians crashed on Sunday. "We suspected all the passengers on board the aircraft have lost their lives. Our preliminary assessment shows no one could have survived the plane crash, but official statement is due," said a spokesperson in Nepal's Home Ministry.

206.title: Sidhu Moosewala's father followed him with 2 policemen in another car, saw his killing
206.article_body: Punjab Police have registered an FIR in connection with Sidhu Moosewala's killing at Sadar police station in Mansa on the statement of his father Balkaur Singh. Singh said he was witness to the fatal attack on his son. Singh "took both police security personnel in his car after he learnt that Moosewala had left home without guards", the FIR said.

207.title: Uniform Civil Code is not against Muslims: Uttar Pradesh minister
207.article_body: UP minister Danish Azad Ansari said the Uniform Civil Code is not against Muslims and no one's constitutional rights are being violated. "We've to listen to the voice of common Muslims," Ansari added. "Today, they want to progress that was not done by previous governments, like, SP, BSP and Congress. They only used Muslims as a vote bank," he stated.

208.title: Sidhu Moosewala's family refuses to allow post-mortem on his body: Reports
208.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala's family has refused to allow post-mortem on his body, reports said. This comes after senior police officials held discussion with the late singer's family. The family members have sought NIA probe into the murder and action against officials who leaked the list of individuals who were stripped of security cover

209.title: Prices of tomatoes may soon cross ₹100 per kg in Pune: Traders
209.article_body: As tomato prices have crossed the ₹80 per kg mark in several areas of Pune, traders reportedly said that the price would soon cross ₹100 per kg. Reports said that lower than expected plantation is the main reason for price rise. For the last three years, farmers have reportedly blamed the tomato mosaic virus for loss of produce.

210.title: Children who lost parents to COVID-19 to get ₹4,000 per month: PM Modi
210.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday announced that children who lost their parents to COVID-19 will be provided ₹4,000 monthly through various schemes to meet their daily requirements. Releasing the benefits under the PM CARES for Children scheme, he added, "If someone needs an education loan for professional courses, for higher education, then PM CARES will help in that too."

211.title: People love Hardik because of things he does on field, not off the field: Sehwag
211.article_body: Questioning GT captain Hardik Pandya's critics, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said the all-rounder "stood apart across all three departments" in IPL 2022 and people love him "because of the things he does on the field, not off the field". Sehwag added, "The personality off the field does not matter, it is absolutely irrelevant...it makes no impact on the field."

212.title: France to euthanise killer whale suffering from black fungus
212.article_body: The French authorities have decided to euthanise an orca, also known as killer whale, stranded in the Seine river, after efforts to save it failed. The officials believe that the animal is suffering from mucormycosis or black fungus and is critically ill. A group of experts concluded that it was best to put the animal out of its misery.

213.title: US Prez, First Lady visit site where 21 were killed in shooting
213.article_body: US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden visited the school in Texas where 21 people, including 19 children, were killed in a shooting. The Bidens paid respects to the deceased at the memorial site at Robb Elementary School and attended a church mass. People outside the church urged Biden to "do something". "We will," replied President Biden.

214.title: Another Tara Air plane crashed on same Nepal route in 2016 killing 23 passengers
214.article_body: In 2016, a Tara Air plane carrying 23 passengers from Pokhara to Jomsom in Nepal lost contact and was later found crashed, killing all passengers on board. While the total time of the flight was 19 minutes, it lost contact eight minutes after taking off. The wreckage of the Tara Air flight with 22 passengers was found on Monday.

215.title: PM gives guidance to world but is silent on violence in Andhra: Raut
215.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi gives guidance to the world but is silent on occasions like violence in Andhra Pradesh over renaming of Konaseema district after Dr Ambedkar. "Modi is leading the nation with the maximum number of unemployed people and...he attends events on world stage," he added.

216.title: Ranveer Singh, Varun Dhawan condole Sidhu Moosewala's demise
216.article_body: Ranveer Singh and Varun Dhawan took to their respective social media handles to express condolences on the demise of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala. "RIP. Your words and music will live on. Can't believe this," Varun wrote. Meanwhile, Ranveer shared a picture of Moosewala with a caption that read, "Immortal." Moosewala was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday.

217.title: I am Hindu but not fool, we don't make religion an event: Kamal Nath
217.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Congress chief Kamal Nath said religion is not the basis of politics. "We don't consider religion as the basis of our politics. We don't make religion an event," Nath added. "I proudly say that I am Hindu but I am not a fool…Our religion is an event of our family, it's not an event of politics," Nath stated.

218.title: He can influence people without even trying: Naga on 'Laal...' co-star Aamir
218.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya, who'll be making his Bollywood debut with 'Laal Singh Chaddha', opened up about his experience while working with Aamir Khan. "One thing is for sure that, what I've learnt in last 12 years, I learnt from him in 45 days," he said. "He's got this amazing magic that he can influence people without even trying," Naga added.

219.title: 3 killed, 9 injured after lightning strikes eatery in Chhattisgarh
219.article_body: Three people, including a 12-year-old girl, were killed and nine others were injured in a lightning strike in Chhattisgarh's Jashpur on Sunday, police said. According to preliminary information, lightning had struck an eatery at a weekly market, the district Additional SP Pratibha Pandey said. Meanwhile, state CM Bhupesh Baghel announced ₹4 lakh each as compensation to the deceased's families.

220.title: Civic body to remove illegal gates of housing societies in Ghaziabad
220.article_body: In a move to free public roads, the Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation has decided to remove illegal gates of non-gated housing societies. "The corporation has not given any permission...and...movement of public cannot be restricted," an official said. "There are many societies in Shalimar Garden, Rajendra Nagar...who do not allow gates to be opened up for the public," a resident said.

221.title: Gleam on the face of this man tells he will die young: Moosewala sang in 'The Last Ride'
221.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala in one of his last songs 'The Last Ride' sang, "Moosewala has become immortal in his life, but the gleam on the face of this man tells that he will die young." Moosewala said in interviews that his inspiration was Tupac Shakur (known as 2Pac), the American rapper who too was shot dead in his car in 1996.

222.title: The fire could be heard in the village for a few minutes: Moosewala murder witness
222.article_body: An eyewitness at Jawahar Ke village where Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead has said, "The fire could be heard in the village for a few minutes." He added, "A white car came from behind and then drove parallel to Moosewala's car before opening fire...Then the white car drove up ahead and opened fire from the front."

223.title: 'I will live here and I will die here', Moosewala told voters at his village during polls
223.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala promised voters while campaigning during Punjab polls that he will always be there in his ancestral village. "I am not going anywhere. I will live here and I will die here," he would tell voters during the campaign in February. Moosewala, who was shot dead on Sunday, had fought Punjab elections for Congress from Mansa seat.

224.title: He'll have to think about bowling more off spin: Sangakkara on Ashwin
224.article_body: RR's Director of Cricket Kumar Sangakkara has said Ravichandran Ashwin needs to think about bowling more off-spin deliveries. "Even for Ashwin, being a legend in terms of what he has achieved...there will be a lot of thinking and improvements to do," stated Sangakkara after their seven-wicket defeat against GT in IPL 2022 final. Ashwin registered figures of 3-0-32-0 against GT.

225.title: Sensex jumps over 900 points to 55,792, Nifty above 16,500
225.article_body: BSE Sensex rallied over 900 points to trade at 55,792 while the Nifty50 advanced 258 points to 16,611 during Monday's early trade. While Infosys, Mahindra & Mahindra, Wipro and Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) were among the top Sensex gainers, shares of IRCTC rose nearly 5% in early trade ahead of its earnings to be announced today.

226.title: India may face power crisis in July-Aug amid coal shortage: Report
226.article_body: A report by the Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air (CREA), an independent research organisation, has suggested India may face a power crisis in July-August amid a coal shortage. As per CREA, the coal power plants cannot "address even a minor spike in the power demand" while it predicted a peak power demand of 214 GW in August.

227.title: After Ram Temple in Ayodhya, looks like Kashi & Mathura waking up too: UP CM
227.article_body: The temple town of Kashi appears to be waking up, as are Mathura, Vrindavan, Vindhyavasini Dham and Naimish Dham, after the construction of Ram Temple in Ayodhya, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said. "In this situation, we all have to move forward once again," CM Yogi added. His remarks came amid legal proceedings over the temple-mosque issues in Varanasi and Mathura.

228.title: JD(S) workers, farmer leader Kodihalli's supporters clash in B'luru
228.article_body: JD(S) workers and supporters of Karnataka Rajya Raitha Sangha leader Kodihalli Chandrashekar clashed in Bengaluru as the farmer leader arrived at the Press Club to address corruption charges raised against him over KSRTC workers' protests. The JD(S) workers had raised slogans and reportedly tried to stop Chandrashekar from entering the Press Club. Chandrashekar had joined AAP recently.

229.title: India reports 2,706 new COVID-19 cases, 25 deaths in last 24 hours
229.article_body: India has reported 2,706 COVID-19 cases, 2,070 recoveries and 25 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,828 COVID-19 cases and 14 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 17,698, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,611.

230.title: Take action against these criminals: Mika on Sidhu Moosewala's death
230.article_body: Singer Mika Singh, taking to Twitter, mourned the demise of Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala. "My prayers are with his family. Request to Punjab government, please take strong action against these criminals," Mika tweeted. "People will always remember your name...the respect you earned and all your hit records," he added. Sidhu was killed in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday.

231.title: I still get anxious thinking about hurtling down Indian roads: Actor Sam Neill
231.article_body: Hollywood actor Sam Neill, sharing his experience of working in India, said, "It was...amazing." "I still get anxious when I think of hurtling down Indian roads in one of those sort of 50s Morris taxis, dodging people...I'd have to close my eyes...because every minute we seem to be close to death," he added. Sam came to India in the 90s.

232.title: Fire breaks out in Delhi's Dwarka building, 52 people evacuated; 10 vehicles gutted
232.article_body: Ten vehicles were burnt after a fire broke out in the parking of a building in Delhi. The incident took place in Dwarka on Sunday night. After the fire broke out in the building, 52 people were evacuated. Among the evacuated were five people who sustained minor injuries during the incident.

233.title: Some of the bodies of the passengers are beyond recognition: Official on Nepal plane crash
233.article_body: The wreckage of Nepal's Tara Air aircraft which went missing with 22 people on board on Sunday was physically located in Mustang district on Monday. Chief District Officer of Mustang, Netra Prasad Sharma said, "Some of the bodies of the passengers are beyond recognition. Police are gathering the remain." Notably, A family of four Indians was also aboard the plane.

234.title: Full list of IPL 2022 award winners with cash prize released
234.article_body: RR opener Jos Buttler won 'Orange Cap' for scoring the most runs (863), while RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal won 'Purple Cap' for taking the most wickets (27) in IPL 2022. Umran Malik won the 'Emerging Player' award, while Jos Buttler won the award for most sixes (45). RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik was named 'Super Striker' of the season.

235.title: India Post delivers mail using drone for 1st time under pilot project in Guj
235.article_body: In a first, the Department of Posts delivered mail using a drone under a pilot project in Gujarat. The drone covered a distance of 46 km in 25 minutes, said an official. The pilot project studied the cost of drone deliveries and roadblocks in the process. "If the experiment is commercially successful...postal parcel delivery services will be faster," PIB stated.

236.title: Protest held at Greater Noida society after 2 kids fell from 9th floor
236.article_body: Days after two kids fell from the shaft of the ninth floor of Supertech Ecovillage-2 society in Greater Noida West, the residents held a protest against the builder over safety lapses. The new towers, where possession has been recently given, don't have quality work, complained a resident. The Greater Noida Authority has served a notice to Supertech over compliance.

237.title: This season was really special, really proud of my team: Samson
237.article_body: RR captain Sanju Samson said it was "one off day" for them as they lost the IPL 2022 final to GT but he's "really proud" of his team. "Last two-three seasons...everyone was having a really hard time. Good to give them some happy moments," he added. RR had finished among the bottom two teams in the last three seasons.

238.title: BJP needs no certificate from Majlis: G Kishan Reddy on Owaisi's remarks
238.article_body: Union Minister G Kishan Reddy has responded to AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi's recent statements that the BJP and RSS are "only after Mughals". "Numerous Hindus had to leave their residence under Owaisi's leadership...We don't want the certificate of Majlis party given to us nor to our government," Reddy said. He added that Owaisi is selling and telling stories.

239.title: Family asked me to think twice: Archana on marrying 7 years younger Parmeet
239.article_body: Actress Archana Puran Singh said her family had asked her to "think twice" before she married actor Parmeet Sethi since he is seven years younger than her. "I never had any doubt in my mind...after 30 years and two sons...we are still a couple who...has faced ups and downs of life together without...age factor ever coming in focus," she added.

240.title: Indian family on board Nepal flight were on a trip due to a divorce order
240.article_body: A divorced couple and their two children, who were among the 22 people on board the plane that crashed in Nepal, were on a family holiday ordered by a court after their divorce. As per a police official, the family got together for 10 days every year after the couple's divorce. On Monday, the wreckage of the plane was found.

241.title: Pune man seeks ₹9 cr as extortion from real estate developer; held
241.article_body: Pune's Wakad police have arrested a man for allegedly demanding about ₹9 crore as extortion from a real estate developer. The accused had filed a case with NGT claiming that there were irregularities in a project and sought 2.5% of the project cost as extortion, according to police. The police caught the accused as he accepted a ₹2 crore cheque.

242.title: Police deployed outside Sidhu Moosewala's residence in Punjab's Moosa
242.article_body: A large force of Punjab Police has been deployed outside the residence of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala in Moosa. He was shot dead in Mansa district. State Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja Warring and ex-Deputy CM Sukhjinder Singh Randhawa met Moosewala’s family members on Sunday evening. "We'll take immediate action against gangster and persons involved," Mansa SSP, Gaurav Toora, said.

243.title: T20s may be batters' game but bowlers win you matches: Hardik
243.article_body: After defeating RR to win IPL 2022 in their first-ever season, GT captain Hardik Pandya said, "T20s may be batters' game but bowlers win you [matches]." He added, "We spoke about creating a legacy...everyone will remember this was the team who started this journey." GT restricted RR to 130/9 and won the game by seven wickets in 18.1 overs.

244.title: Nagpur woman drinks pesticide after mistaking it for cough syrup, dies
244.article_body: A 74-year-old woman, Nagobai Vijay Koku, died after she drank pesticide after mistaking it for cough syrup in Nagpur. Police said that the woman had been ailing for the past few days. A police official said that the woman had consumed the pesticide on May 21 and died on Sunday in a nearby hospital.

245.title: Pune civic body planning to build walking plaza at Sarasbaug
245.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is planning to build a walking plaza at Sarasbaug after clearing the encroachments along the road. "The anti-encroachment department sealed all 56 stalls and took action against the owners," said an official. "We have decided to create a walking plaza on the same road allowing these stalls to work in their stipulated areas," he added.

246.title: Who are Goldy Brar and Lawrence Bishnoi, suspects in Sidhu Moosewala's killing?
246.article_body: Punjab's DGP VK Bhawra said Lawrence Bishnoi gang and Canada-based gangster Goldy Brar are involved in Sidhu Moosewala's killing. Brar, whose real name is Satinder Singh, is part of Bishnoi's gang and is wanted in many criminal cases by Indian authorities. Bishnoi is lodged in a Rajasthan jail and his gang has criminal records in Delhi, Rajasthan, Punjab and Haryana.

247.title: Like demon preaching vedas: FRL's independent directors on Amazon's 'fraud' claim
247.article_body: The independent directors of Future Retail Limited (FRL) have rejected Amazon's allegations that the company facilitated a fraudulent strategy for the transfer of 835 stores to Reliance Retail and called it a "false statement". In a letter, they wrote, "It is not for a company like yours to preach governance to us. This is akin to a demon preaching vedas."

248.title: People think I know police department, I get pleas for help: Anup on 'Crime...'
248.article_body: Actor Anup Soni, while talking about his role as a host on 'Crime Patrol', said that people have a misconception that he knows the entire police department. "I get pleas for help all the time! I get so many emails from people. Now how do I explain to them that I am a common man like you," he added.

249.title: Jos Buttler creates history, scores most runs by an overseas player in an IPL season
249.article_body: RR opener Jos Buttler has created history by scoring the most runs by an overseas player in an IPL season. Buttler aggregated 863 runs in IPL 2022, overtaking David Warner's tally of 848 runs in IPL 2016. Only Virat Kohli (973 runs in IPL 2016) has scored more runs in an IPL season than Buttler.

250.title: Hardik's wife Nataša tears up on meeting him after GT win IPL 2022, video viral
250.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Hardik Pandya's wife Nataša Stanković teared up on meeting Hardik after his team defeated RR to win IPL 2022 at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Sunday. A video has gone viral showing the duo meeting after GT's win. Hardik can be seen consoling her as she gets emotional.

251.title: Buttler throws helmet, gloves in frustration after getting out in IPL final, video viral
251.article_body: A video has gone viral showing RR opener Jos Buttler throwing his helmet and gloves in frustration after getting out in the IPL 2022 final against GT. Buttler was dismissed for 39(35) on the bowling of GT captain Hardik Pandya. GT went on to defeat RR by seven wickets in the final to clinch IPL 2022.

252.title: Mahesh Babu known for witty remarks, I've seen SRK doing it: Adivi Sesh
252.article_body: Reacting to actor Mahesh Babu's 'Bollywood can't afford me' remark, actor Adivi Sesh has said, "We South Indian people are aware of the fact that Mahesh is known for his witty and fun remarks." "I have seen Shah Rukh (Khan) sir doing it, but those don't become headlines," he added. Adivi stated that Mahesh's remark was said in "half jest".

253.title: Pune reports 59 new COVID-19 cases, majority in city
253.article_body: Pune district registered 59 new COVID-19 cases, the Maharashtra health department said on Sunday. No new deaths were recorded and the number of active cases stood at 333. The majority of the new cases were reported in the Pune city area where 43 infections were detected. Over 20,000 people have died of COVID-19 in the district so far.

254.title: Video shows 2 cars tailing Sidhu Moosewala's vehicle before he was shot dead
254.article_body: A CCTV footage has surfaced online showing two cars tailing Sidhu Moosewala's vehicle moments before the singer-politician was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa district. "Two cars intercepted [his vehicle] which followed heavy firing," the police said. As per the police, a member of Lawrence Bishnoi gang from Canada has taken the responsibility for killing Moosewala.

255.title: Crash site of Nepal plane carrying 22 people including 4 Indians located, pic surfaces
255.article_body: The crash site of Nepal's Tara Air plane carrying 22 people including four Indians has been located. The Nepal Army Spokesperson shared a picture from the crash site and wrote, "Search and rescue troops have physically located the plane crash site. Details will be followed...Crash site: Sanosware, Thasang-2, Mustang." The flight had lost contact at around 10 am on Sunday.

256.title: Gujarat Titans defeat Rajasthan Royals to win IPL 2022 in their first-ever season
256.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) defeated Rajasthan Royals (RR) by seven wickets in the final at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad to win IPL 2022 in their first-ever season. GT restricted RR to 130/9 in their 20 overs and went on to chase the target in 18.1 overs. RR, who had won IPL in 2008, were featuring in their second final.

257.title: I'm working on my strike rate to earn place in CWG, T20Is squads: Taniyaa
257.article_body: India Women wicketkeeper-batter Taniyaa Bhatia said she has been working on her strike rate to earn a spot in India's squad ahead of 2022 Commonwealth Games and upcoming T20Is. Taniyaa didn't play a single match in 2022 World Cup despite being included in squad. "I thought during...World Cup that when I go back I'll work on my batting," she added.

258.title: Salah, Mane didn't have same freshness in Champions League final: Wenger
258.article_body: Ex-Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger said Mohamed Salah and Sadio Mane lacked the "same freshness and belief" that they can make the difference in Liverpool's 0-1 loss to Real Madrid in 2022 Champions League final. "Overall they came short, we must be honest, because of Thibaut Courtois." Real Madrid goalkeeper Courtois made nine saves, most in a Champions League final.

259.title: Don't tell my mother, she's critical: Sister of woman on missing flight to police
259.article_body: The elder sister of an Indian woman who was onboard the Nepal flight that's suspected to have crashed told police not to inform their mother about the incident. Thane resident Vaibhavi Bandekar Tripathi's sister made the request as her mother is in a critical condition, an official said. Vaibhavi's estranged husband and their two children were also on the flight.

260.title: One of Moosewala's last songs titled 'The Last Ride' had pic of shot up car on cover
260.article_body: After Sidhu Moosewala's death on Sunday, some fans talked about the Punjabi singer's song 'The Last Ride' that was released two weeks ago. The song's album cover showed a BMW car that US rapper Tupac Shakur was shot dead in, in 1996. Moosewala was shot dead while driving his jeep in Punjab's Mansa.

261.title: EU unity on Russian sanctions starting to crumble, says Germany
261.article_body: German Economy Minister Robert Habeck on Sunday said that European Union's unity was "starting to crumble" ahead of a summit to discuss an oil embargo against Russia and plans to cut dependence on Russian energy. EU leaders are scheduled to meet next week to discuss these measures. The bloc has imposed economic sanctions on Russia over the invasion of Ukraine.

262.title: Climate-aid pledges by rich nations are worthless, says Seychelles
262.article_body: Seychelles' President Wavel Ramkalawan has said that climate-aid pledges by industrialised nations are worthless. He claimed that the promises made at last year's United Nations Climate Change Conference, COP26, have not been met. Ramkalawan also said he expects nothing better at this year's COP27 that is scheduled to be held in Egypt.

263.title: IPL share video of Lockie Ferguson clocking fastest delivery of IPL 2022
263.article_body: The IPL have shared a video of GT fast bowler Lockie Ferguson clocking the fastest delivery of IPL 2022. Ferguson clocked 157.3 kmph on the last delivery of RR's fifth over in IPL 2022 final. RR opener Jos Buttler was beaten by the delivery which was bowled just short of a yorker length outside the off stump.

264.title: Cong releases list of 10 candidates for RS polls, fields P Chidambaram from TN
264.article_body: The Congress on Sunday released its list of 10 candidates for the Rajya Sabha elections. The party has fielded P Chidambaram from Tamil Nadu, Randeep Singh Surjewala from Rajasthan and Ajay Maken from Haryana. The elections for 57 seats spread across 15 states is scheduled to take place on June 10.

265.title: Ukraine Prez visits frontline areas outside Kyiv 1st time since war
265.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy visited troops on frontlines of the country's northeastern Kharkiv region on Sunday, marking his first official appearance outside Kyiv since the war began. He reportedly carried gifts and commendations for the troops. Zelenskyy also toured destroyed residential buildings, noting that their replacements have to be constructed with bomb shelters in place.

266.title: Teenagers Gauff, Fernandez enter quarter-finals at French Open
266.article_body: American Coco Gauff, the 18th seed, entered French Open quarter-finals for the second straight year after defeating Belgium's Elise Mertens 6-4, 6-0 in fourth round on Sunday. It was the 18-year-old's second career win against Mertens. Meanwhile, 19-year old Leylah Fernandez of Canada reached her maiden Roland Garros quarter-final after a 6-3, 4-6, 6-3 win over 27th seed Amanda Anisimova.

267.title: Punjab is up in flames: BJP leader on Sidhu Moosewala's killing
267.article_body: Reacting to the demise of singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Punjab, BJP leader Amit Malviya said, "Punjab is up in flames!" "Is...Sidhu Moosewala's cold-blooded murder the change AAP promised?" he asked. "[AAP chief] Arvind Kejriwal and [MP] Raghav Chadha, who run Punjab by proxy, must be held accountable for this murder," Malviya further said.

268.title: Sri Lankan PM proposes to make Prez accountable to Parliament
268.article_body: The Sri Lankan government is working to make the President and the Cabinet accountable to the Parliament, Sri Lanka's PM Ranil Wickremesinghe said on Sunday. Over a dozen independent committees would be set up for parliamentary oversight and supervision of financial matters, he added. Wickremesinghe's comments come amid a severe economic crisis in the country.

269.title: Singer Edava Basheer collapses on stage during live concert, dies
269.article_body: Veteran Malayalam singer Edava Basheer passed away on Saturday after collapsing onstage during a live performance in Kerala's Alappuzha. The 78-year-old was rushed to a private hospital at Cherthala but could not be saved. The late singer was a resident of Kollam and is survived by his wives Rasheeda and Rehna and four children Ullas, Beema, Umesh and Ushus Seetta.

270.title: Centre scared of Gupkar, their Kashmir policy has failed: Mufti
270.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti has claimed that the Centre is scared of People's Alliance for Gupkar Declaration (PAGD), also known as the 'Gupkar alliance', adding that the Centre's policy has failed in J&K. "If [Gupkar comes] together, [Centre's]...plan will fail in...valley," she added. PAGD is a political grouping which was formed after the abrogation of Article 370.

271.title: Newborn's body found floating in Raj well day after 5 bodies recovered
271.article_body: A newborn baby's body was seen floating in a well in Rajasthan's Jaipur, a day after bodies of three sisters, two of whom were pregnant, and their two children were recovered from the same well. Police said the newborn's body has been sent to a hospital for a DNA test. Police have arrested five persons in connection with the case.

272.title: Moosewala had 2 commandos for security, didn't take them with him today: Police
272.article_body: Deceased singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala had four police commanders for his protection, of which two were withdrawn recently, Punjab Police DGP VK Bhawra said. Moosewala didn't take the two commandos with him on Sunday when he was shot dead, Bhawra added. "Moosewala had a private bulletproof car that he didn't take with him," the DGP added.

273.title: Lawrence Bishnoi gang member from Canada claims responsibility for Moosewala's murder
273.article_body: Punjab DGP VK Bhawra has said that Lawrence Bishnoi gang is involved in singer Sidhu Moosewala's murder, adding, "Lucky, a member of the gang from Canada, has taken responsibility of the attack." Meanwhile, reports have claimed that gangster Lawrence Bishnoi's Canada-based associate Goldy Brar took responsibility of the attack in a Facebook post. The attack took place in Mansa district.

274.title: Over 1 lakh people sing 'Vande Mataram' during IPL 2022 closing ceremony, video viral
274.article_body: A video has gone viral showing over 1 lakh people singing 'Vande Mataram' during the IPL 2022 closing ceremony at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. The crowd sang 'Vande Mataram' while AR Rahman was performing his rendition of the song. Actor Ranveer Singh also performed during the closing ceremony.

275.title: Still trying to wrap my head around it: Ajay on Sidhu Moosewala's death
275.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn has reacted to 28-year-old Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's death. He wrote on Twitter, "Stunned by the shocking death of #SidhuMoosewala. May Waheguru give his loved ones strength in their hour of grief.  RIP departed soul. Still trying to wrap my head around this one." Sidhu was killed on Sunday in Punjab's Mansa District.

276.title: Turkey won't let terrorism-supporting nations join NATO, says Prez
276.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan has said that Turkey cannot agree to the NATO membership of "terrorism-supporting" countries. He also said that talks with Finland and Sweden about their NATO bids weren't at the "expected level". Turkey has challenged the NATO membership bids from Sweden and Finland on grounds that the countries harbour people linked to a Kurdish militant group.

277.title: BJP only talks about communalism, has no other topics: Baghel
277.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Saturday claimed that the BJP only discusses issues linked to communalism and religious conversion as the party has no other topics to address. Baghel further stated that the state government has always taken action when it received reports of forced religious conversion incidents. "Every person is free to follow their religion," he added.

278.title: Artist I listened to almost everyday: Vikrant condoles Sidhu's death
278.article_body: Actor Vikrant Massey has condoled the demise of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala who was killed on Sunday in Punjab's Mansa. Vikrant tweeted, "Shocked, numb & at a loss for words. An Artist I listened to almost every single day. A voice one knew was blessed from above. Condolences & prayers for strength to his family & millions of his fans."

279.title: Our song was going to release soon: Salim on Sidhu Moosewala's death
279.article_body: Composer-singer Salim Merchant took to social media to condole the demise of 28-year-old Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala. Salim shared a picture of himself with Sidhu and wrote, "I'm shocked & saddened by the news. Sidhu was a gem.. our song was going to release very soon.. this is unbelievable." Sidhu was killed in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday.

280.title: Very bot-friendly rules: Musk on Twitter allowing 2,400 tweets per day to a user
280.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said Twitter has "very bot-friendly rules" after a user tweeted the platform's current technical limits for accounts. Twitter currently allows a user to send 2,400 tweets per day and make up to four changes per hour to their account's email address. Musk earlier put on hold the $44-billion deal to acquire Twitter over fake account data.

281.title: He has learnt a lot from Dhoni: Gavaskar on Hardik's captaincy in IPL 2022
281.article_body: Commenting on Hardik Pandya's captaincy style in IPL 2022, Sunil Gavaskar said, "It seems as if he has learnt a lot from MS Dhoni. He considers Dhoni his elder brother and...hero." He added, "His man-management style is Dhoni's approach...his success as captain is a positive sign for Team India." Hardik-led GT have reached the IPL final in their debut season.

282.title: Return of terrorism in Punjab: Ashoke Pandit on Sidhu Moosewala's demise
282.article_body: Indian Film & Television Directors' Association President Ashoke Pandit has posted a series of tweets reacting to Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's demise. He wrote, "[His] killing in broad day light indicates the return of terrorism in Punjab under the nose of @ArvindKejriwal who was supported by #Khalistanis. Punjab is a border state and it cannot be ruled by terror supporters."

283.title: Train services between India & B'desh resume after 2 yrs: Official
283.article_body: The passenger train services between Bangladesh and India resumed on Sunday, according to a Bangladesh Railway (BR) spokesman. Notably, the passenger train services between the two countries have resumed after a break of two years due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The train service between Dhaka and Kolkata would be operated five days a week, a senior BR official said.

284.title: Ex-Sri Lankan PM summoned by human rights body over May 9 clashes
284.article_body: The Human Rights Commission of Sri Lanka has summoned ex-PM Mahinda Rajapaksa to obtain a statement from him regarding clashes that broke out in Colombo on May 9. This comes days after Rajapaksa gave a three-hour-long statement to authorities amid allegations that his party's supporters attacked anti-government protesters in the clashes. At least 10 people died due to violence.

285.title: Urge everyone to stay calm, guilty will be punished: Kejriwal on Moosewala's killing
285.article_body: AAP national convener Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said he spoke to Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann about the murder of Sidhu Moosewala in Mansa, adding that the killing was "sad and shocking". He said, "The culprits will be given the harshest punishment. I request everyone to stay strong and maintain calm." Those involved in the killing won't be spared, Mann said.

286.title: Abject law & order breakdown in Punjab: Badal on Moosewala's death
286.article_body: Reacting to the murder of Congress leader and Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) President Sukhbir Singh Badal said that Punjab exhibits an "abject breakdown of law and order". Expressing shock, Badal added that those responsible for the crime should be arrested immediately. Moosewala was reportedly shot over 20 times by unknown assailants in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday.

287.title: Sidhu Moosewala was an icon, hope perpetrators brought to justice: Sophie
287.article_body: Singer Sophie Choudry took to Twitter to mourn the demise of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala who was killed in Punjab's Mansa on Sunday. She wrote, "This is such tragic & shocking news...A music icon, a legend! My deepest condolences to his family & his fans across the world. Hope the perpetrators are brought to justice...This is truly sad."

288.title: Lockie Ferguson bowls fastest delivery of IPL 2022 in final, breaks Umran Malik's record
288.article_body: GT fast bowler Lockie Ferguson bowled the fastest delivery of IPL 2022 by clocking 157.3 kmph against RR opener Jos Buttler in the final on Sunday. Ferguson broke the record held by SRH fast bowler Umran Malik, who had clocked 157 kmph against DC on May 5. Ferguson replaced Alzarri Joseph in GT's playing XI for the final.

289.title: Defending champion Djokovic enters 13th straight French Open quarters
289.article_body: Defending champion Novak Djokovic reached his 13th consecutive French Open quarter-final following a 6-1, 6-3, 6-3 win against 15th-seeded Diego Schwartzman in the fourth round on Sunday. The top seed is now 16-0 in fourth round matches at Roland Garros. Djokovic hasn't dropped a set in the tournament so far. He awaits Rafael Nadal or Felix Auger-Aliassime in the last-eight.

290.title: He's a legend & will never be forgotten, sad day: Vishal on Sidhu's death
290.article_body: Singer-composer Vishal Dadlani reacted to Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's death, calling it a sad day. Vishal wrote on Twitter, "The news of his demise has cut deep. India has very few authentic modern artists. He was right on top of that list. I'm without words. He's a legend, his voice, his courage & his words will never be forgotten."

291.title: Nobody safe in Punjab: Ex-CM Amarinder on Sidhu Moosewala's murder
291.article_body: Former Punjab CM Amarinder Singh on Sunday, while condoling the demise of singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Mansa, said, "Nobody is safe in Punjab." "The brutal murder of Sidhu Moosewala is shocking...Law and order has completely collapsed in Punjab," Amarinder tweeted. "The AAP government in Punjab has failed miserably," the Congress veteran further said.

292.title: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' director calls Aamir Khan 'mahapurush' in note
292.article_body: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' director Advait Chandan on Sunday shared a note for Aamir Khan on Instagram making a reference to his 1994 film 'Andaz Apna Apna'. Advait wrote, "You're the best, sir...Grand Chess Master, [Rubik's] Cube Meister...the sharpest editor, the most generous producer! Sir, aap...swami ho, antaryaami ho...balki main toh kehta hoon sir, ke aap purush hi nahin... Mahapurush ho!"

293.title: Very shocking & sad: Kapil Sharma mourns Sidhu Moosewala's demise
293.article_body: Comedian Kapil Sharma on Sunday took to Twitter to mourn the death of 28-year-old Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala who was killed in Punjab's Mansa. Kapil tweeted, "Satnam shri Waheguru. very shocking n very sad, a great artist n a wonderful human being, may god give the strengths to his family #sidhumoosewala."

294.title: AAP tinkered with security for publicity: Jakhar on Moosewala's death
294.article_body: BJP's Sunil Jakhar on Sunday termed the murder of Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala "utterly shocking", stating that CM Bhagwant Mann-led AAP government should be held accountable. Jakhar, who recently quit Congress, added that AAP had tinkered with "security issues to gain cheap publicity". Moosewala was shot dead in Punjab's Mansa a day after police withdrew his security.

295.title: Nadal is favourite to win French Open but favourites don't always win: Goran
295.article_body: Novak Djokovic's coach Goran Ivanisevic has said 13-time champion Rafael Nadal is the "favourite" to win the 2022 French Open, but "historically the favourites don't always win." He added that Nadal was the favourite last year as well, but he didn't win the title. Djokovic defeated Nadal in the semi-final at French Open last year.

296.title: Sidhu Moosewala died after sustaining 8 bullet wounds
296.article_body: Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala sustained at least eight bullet wounds in the attack on Sunday, police officials said while quoting doctors. More than 20 bullets were fired at the 28-year-old singer by unknown assailants while he was travelling in an SUV. A doctor said that Moosewala was dead when he was brought to hospital.

297.title: Tehrik-e-Taliban Pakistan persistent threat to Pak's security: UN
297.article_body: Pakistan faces a persistent threat from Afghanistan-based Tehrik-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP), according to a UN report. TTP has up to 4,000 fighters along Afghanistan-Pakistan border, the report said. "TTP has arguably benefited the most of all the foreign extremist groups in Afghanistan from the Taliban takeover. It has conducted numerous attacks and operations in Pakistan," it added.

298.title: Nobody involved will be spared: Punjab CM Mann on Sidhu Moosewala's killing
298.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Sunday said he was "shocked and deeply saddened by the gruesome murder" of Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in Mansa today. He added, "Nobody involved will be spared. My thoughts and prayers are with his family...I appeal to everyone to stay calm." Moosewala's security was withdrawn recently.

299.title: BJP releases list of 16 Rajya Sabha candidates, fields Sitharaman from K'taka
299.article_body: The BJP on Sunday announced its list of 16 candidates for the Rajya Sabha elections. The elections for 57 seats spread across 15 states is scheduled to take place on June 10. The party has fielded Union ministers Nirmala Sitharaman and Piyush Goyal from Karnataka and Maharashtra, respectively.

300.title: Deeply shocked & saddened: Rahul Gandhi on Sidhu Moosewala's death
300.article_body: Rahul Gandhi on Sunday reacted to the death of 28-year-old Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala who was killed in Mansa. "Deeply shocked and saddened by the murder of promising Congress leader and talented artist, Sidhu Moosewala. My heartfelt condolences to his loved ones and fans from across the world," said Rahul. Sidhu had fought recent Punjab polls.

301.title: Sridevi was superstar of 80s-90s, she was from south: Rohit Shetty
301.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty has commented on the north-south cinema debate, saying that actresses like Sridevi and Jaya Prada, who were superstars of the 80s and 90s, were from the south. He further said that when Amitabh Bachchan and Vinod Khanna were at their peak in the 80s, Kamal Haasan entered Bollywood with 'Ek Duuje Ke Liye' which was a hit.

302.title: Pak govt bans rallies in Islamabad after ex-PM's 'Azadi March'
302.article_body: Pakistan's federal government on Friday imposed a permanent ban on entry of rallies and processions in Islamabad. Rallies in the city will only be permitted after a written agreement between organisers and the city's administration. This comes days after clashes broke out at ex-PM Imran Khan 'Azadi March', which was headed towards Islamabad, and led to arrest of several people.

303.title: Who were the highest paid CEOs of Fortune 500 companies in 2021?
303.article_body: Tesla's Elon Musk was the highest paid CEO on the list of Fortune 500 companies in 2021, with a "realised" compensation worth $23.5 billion. He was followed by Apple CEO Tim Cook ($770.5 million), NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang ($561 million) and Netflix co-CEO Reed Hastings ($453.5 million). Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella ranked seventh on the list with $309.4 million compensation.

304.title: RR to bat first against GT in IPL 2022 final, playing XIs announced
304.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) captain Sanju Samson won the toss and elected to bat first against Gujarat Titans (GT) in IPL 2022 final at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. RR are fielding an unchanged side, while Lockie Ferguson has replaced Alzarri Joseph in GT's playing XI. GT defeated RR in their previous two matches against each other in IPL 2022.

305.title: Navneet Rana, husband booked for norm violations during event in Maha
305.article_body: Maharashtra MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana were on Sunday booked along with 15 of their supporters for allegedly violating various norms during a welcome event for the couple in Amravati. According to police, the event obstructed traffic at several spots, while an 'aarti' performed by the couple had loudspeakers in use even after 10 pm.

306.title: Pilot's phone helped track down Nepal plane that went missing with 22 on board
306.article_body: The location of the Tara Air flight that went missing with 22 people, including four Indians, on board on Sunday, was tracked down using the GPS location of the pilot's phone, General Manager of Kathmandu's Tribhuvan International Airport said. Premnath Thakur said that the pilot's phone kept ringing and Nepal Army's helicopter landed in the possible accident area.

307.title: More than 20 bullets were fired at Sidhu Moosewala in Punjab
307.article_body: More than 20 bullets were fired at singer Sidhu Moosewala in the attack that killed him on Sunday, several media reports stated. The singer and Congress leader was travelling in Punjab's Mansa when unidentified assailants attacked him. The attack came a day after his security cover was withdrawn by the Punjab government.

308.title: World's largest cricket jersey unveiled by BCCI during IPL 2022 closing ceremony
308.article_body: The BCCI has set the Guinness World Record by creating the world's largest cricket jersey. The jersey, measuring 66 x 42 metres, was unveiled at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad during the closing ceremony ahead of the IPL 2022 final between Gujarat Titans and Rajasthan Royals. The jersey was made to mark 15 years of IPL.

309.title: Congress condoles Sidhu Moosewala's demise, says 'the murder came as a terrible shock'
309.article_body: The Congress party on Sunday condoled the demise of singer and party leader Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in an attack in Punjab's Mansa. "The murder of Shri Sidhu Moose Wala, Congress candidate from Punjab & a talented musician, has come as a terrible shock to the Congress party & the entire nation," the party tweeted.

310.title: BJP leader apologises for 'go home & cook' remark against Supriya Sule
310.article_body: Maharashtra BJP President Chandrakant Patil on Sunday tendered an apology for his "go home and cook" remark against NCP MP Supriya Sule. Patil's apology came in response to a notice sent to him by state women's commission. "By apologising, he has shown his large-heartedness. I request everyone now to put the matter to rest," Sule said, reacting to the apology.

311.title: Dad was called senile for casting Big B in 'Zanjeer': Director's son
311.article_body: Late director Prakash Mehra's son producer Puneet Mehra has revealed that his father was called senile for casting Amitabh Bachchan in 1973 film 'Zanjeer'. Puneet further said, "People thought...'Why is he taking someone who hasn't had hits? Why isn't he going with a newcomer instead?'...Property was at stake, mom's jewellery was at stake. This is exactly how 'Zanjeer' was made."

312.title: Mexico reports its first confirmed case of monkeypox
312.article_body: The first confirmed case of monkeypox was identified in Mexico on Saturday, according to Deputy Health Secretary Hugo López-Gatell Ramírez. The patient is a 50-year-old permanent resident of New York who is being treated in Mexico City, he said. The patient is being isolated and is in stable condition, he added.

313.title: Sidhu Moosewala's security cover was withdrawn by Punjab govt a day ago
313.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala's security was withdrawn by the Punjab government a day before he was shot dead on Sunday. Moosewala was among around 400 people whose securities were withdrawn recently. The singer-turned-Congress leader was killed after around 30 rounds of bullets were fired by unidentified assailants at him in Jawaharke village.

314.title: I really want them to win: Akmal to ex-team RR ahead of IPL 2022 final
314.article_body: Veteran Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Kamran Akmal, who was part of Rajasthan Royals' title winning squad in IPL 2008, said he wants his ex-team to win the IPL 2022 title against GT. "Good to see RR in final...Congratulations to RR's fans, team and management. Best of luck to both teams," he tweeted. It is RR's first final since 2008.

315.title: They were unlucky to lose: Murphy on Liverpool's Champions League loss
315.article_body: Ex-Liverpool player Danny Murphy has said Liverpool were unlucky to lose in the 2022 Champions League final against Real Madrid. "Jurgen Klopp's players will be devastated by the result but they should sleep soundly because overall they were the better team," he added. Real Madrid beat Liverpool 1-0 to win a record-extending 14th title in Paris.

316.title: Sri Lanka to pay $72.6 mn for Russian oil amid economic crisis
316.article_body: Sri Lanka will pay $72.6 million to buy a 90,000-tonne ship consignment of Russian oil that has been docked at Colombo's port for weeks, Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera said on Saturday. Wijesekera added that the payment will help restart the country's sole refinery. Sri Lanka recently hiked the petrol price to LKR 420/litre amid the ongoing economic crisis.

317.title: Video shows bullet holes in Sidhu Moosewala's car after attack that killed him
317.article_body: A video showing bullet holes in singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's car windshield after fatal attack in Punjab's Mansa has surfaced online. The singer was shot dead by unknown assailants and two other people were also reportedly injured in the attack. A doctor said the singer was brought dead to the hospital.

318.title: Carlo Ancelotti becomes most successful manager in Champions League history
318.article_body: Carlo Ancelotti has become the most successful manager in European Cup/Champions League history after leading Real Madrid to glory in 2022 final in Paris. Ancelotti became the first manager to win the tournament four times. He led AC Milan to victory in 2003 and 2007 and led Real Madrid to victory in 2014 during his first spell with the club.

319.title: The worst is behind Vodafone Idea, you just have to wait: Kumar Mangalam Birla
319.article_body: Aditya Birla Group's billionaire Chairman Kumar Mangalam Birla told BQ Prime that "the worst is behind" Vodafone Idea. "It takes some time to get people to start feeling confident about a business...again," Birla, who co-owns the company with Vodafone Group, said. "We'll have to see how things pan out. I'm very positive about it...You just have to wait," he added.

320.title: Fan walks 264 km to meet Ram Charan, creates portrait in paddy field
320.article_body: A fan of actor Ram Charan has walked 264 km to meet him from Telangana's Gadwal. The man named Jairaj has also paid a tribute to the actor by creating an artistic portrait of him with rice crops in his paddy field in Gadwal's Gorlakhan Doddi. Pictures of Ram Charan interacting with the fan have gone viral on social media.

321.title: India Post delivers mail using drone for the first time in Gujarat
321.article_body: For the first time, India Post delivered a mail using a drone as part of a pilot project in Gujarat's Kutch, covering a distance of 46 km in 25 minutes, officials said on Sunday. "With the success of this pilot project, it'll now be possible to make postal deliveries by drones in the future," the Press Information Bureau (PIB) said.

322.title: Singer Sidhu Moosewala shot dead in Punjab
322.article_body: Punjabi Singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead in Punjab on Sunday. The singer was rushed to a hospital after he was allegedly attacked in Jawaharke village in Mansa District. Several videos and pictures purportedly showing the singer at the hospital in the state have also surfaced online.

323.title: Parent asks IAS officer how to prepare Class 5 daughter for IAS; officer shares text
323.article_body: IAS officer Awanish Sharan shared a screenshot of a text message he received from a parent, seeking his guidance to prepare their daughter, who is in Class 5, to become an IAS officer. "What should I reply to this message," Sharan wrote. Responding to Sharan's tweet, IFS officer Parveen Kaswan replied, "They are already late."

324.title: Drunk man rams car into two-wheeler in Mumbai, 1 dead
324.article_body: A 23-year-old man died and his sister suffered serious injuries after a man, who was driving in inebriated condition, rammed his car into their two-wheeler in Mumbai on Sunday, according to a police official. "We found liquor bottles in the car," the official said. "The car has been seized as part of the probe," the official added.

325.title: Search & rescue operations for missing Nepal flight called off for today: Official
325.article_body: Search and rescue operations for the missing Tara Air flight that is suspected to have crashed near a river in Nepal, have been called off for today, the General Manager of Tribhuvan International Airport said. Operations were called off due to snowfall at the possible air crash site, Premnath Thakur said. The flight was carrying 22 passengers including four Indians.

326.title: Man booked for impersonating Delhi Police chief to threaten lawyer
326.article_body: An FIR has been registered against an unknown man, who threatened a Delhi-based lawyer while impersonating Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana. The accused threatened to implicate the lawyer in a false case, police said, adding that the accused had used Asthana's photo as his profile picture on Truecaller. Police suspect that the accused is part of an extortion racket.

327.title: Too little too late: Shatrughan on Aryan's clean chit in drugs case
327.article_body: Actor-politician Shatrughan Sinha reacted to Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan getting a clean chit by NCB in the Mumbai cruise drugs case, calling it "too little too late". He further said it seems like "politics of vendetta", adding that Aryan was victimised for being Shah Rukh Khan's son. "I can understand the pain...Shah Rukh...must have gone through," he said.

328.title: Indian Navy decommissions INS Gomati after 34 years of service
328.article_body: INS Gomati, a Godavari class guided-missile frigate, was decommissioned by the Indian Navy on Saturday after 34 years of service. The ship had been deployed in Operation Cactus, Operation Parakram and Operation Rainbow. The ship's legacy will be kept alive in an open air museum being set up on the banks of Gomti river in Lucknow, according to a report.

329.title: Which countries were India's biggest trade partners in 2021-22?
329.article_body: The US has emerged as India's biggest trade partner in 2021-22 with $119.42 billion in bilateral trade, while China is at the second spot ($115.41 billion). UAE ($72.9 billion), Saudi Arabia ($42.85 billion) and Iraq ($34.33 billion) are among India's top five trade partners. Singapore, Hong Kong, Indonesia, South Korea and Australia are in the top 10 list.

330.title: 300 people barge into Gurugram school during board exams, booked
330.article_body: A group of 300 people allegedly forcefully entered a private school in Gurugram's Pataudi when Class 12 CBSE students were giving their board examinations, police said. The group allegedly manhandled the school staff and also abused and misbehaved with the principal. Police teams were rushed to the school to neutralise the situation and evict the miscreants, who were later booked.

331.title: FTII waste-picker who acted in over 20 student films dies at 82 in Pune
331.article_body: Parvati Limbaji Suryavanshi aka Parubai, who used to be a waste-picker on campus of Film and Television Institute of India (FTII) in Pune, died due to age related issues on Thursday. Parubai was 82 years old. Reports said that she had acted in over 20 student films and relied on the money she received from students for acting in projects.

332.title: Man kills wife for resisting bid to 'sell' minor daughter in Pak
332.article_body: A 27-year-old woman in Pakistan's Sindh province was allegedly killed by her husband for resisting his bid to get their minor daughter married. The accused, Zulfiqar, who was arrested on Friday, had reportedly planned to get his daughter married to a man in exchange for PKR 1,00,000. Zulfiqar had previously "sold" his two other daughters, the victim's brother told police.

333.title: I-T Dept starts probe against UP businessman who hoarded ₹194 cr cash
333.article_body: The Income Tax Department has started an investigation against Kanpur-based perfume businessman Piyush Jain. In December 2021, the Directorate General of GST Intelligence (DGGI) had recovered over ₹194.45 crore cash, 23 kg gold and 600 kg sandalwood from the factory premises of Jain. According to reports, the DGGI had officially shared the information with the Income Tax Department last week.

334.title: Middle overs partnerships could've changed result: Velocity captain Deepti
334.article_body: Following her side's four-run loss against Supernovas in Women’s T20 Challenge final, Velocity captain Deepti Sharma said, “Had we built partnerships in the middle overs, it would not have come down to this.” She added, “Batters did not take responsibility, but Laura Wolvaardt and Simran Bahadur played really well.” Chasing a 166-run target, Velocity managed 161/8 in 20 overs.

335.title: He gets the best out of me: Hardik on GT head coach Nehra
335.article_body: GT skipper Hardik Pandya lauded head coach Ashish Nehra, saying he gets the best out of him and he always enjoys his company. "For me, playing and spending so much time with him is always fun...our cricketing minds work in a similar fashion," he added. Debutants GT will play against RR in the final of IPL 2022 today.

336.title: Kartik Aaryan shares pic as 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' earns ₹100cr
336.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan shared a picture of himself smiling on social media on Sunday, writing, "100 crore wali smile. #BhoolBhulaiyaa2." This comes after his film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' earned over ₹100 crore in less than ten days of its release. The film earlier beat Alia Bhatt's 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' to become 2022's biggest Hindi opener at the Indian box office.

337.title: Set target to win 75 seats in UP in LS polls: CM to BJP workers
337.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Sunday directed BJP workers in state to begin preparations for the 2024 Lok Sabha polls and set a target to win 75 seats. In 2019, BJP had won 62 Lok Sabha seats, while its ally Apna Dal(S) bagged two seats. BJP won a second term in UP, bagging 255 seats in state's recent Assembly polls.

338.title: North Korean drone entering J&K from Pak shot down; magnetic bombs, grenades recovered
338.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police on Sunday said they have shot down a North Korean drone in Kathua district which was entering from Pakistan side. SSP Kathua RC Kotwal said seven UBGL (Under Barrel Grenade Launcher) grenades and seven sticky/magnetic bombs were recovered from the payload attached to the hexacopter. "We've averted a major incident by recovering this material," he added.

339.title: Ranveer shares video rehearsing for IPL finale, does 'Naatu Naatu' step
339.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh on Sunday took to Instagram to share a behind-the-scenes video of the rehearsals for his performance at the 2022 IPL finale. He wrote alongside the video, "Capacity Crowd? Just bring it!" The actor can be seen practicing the hook steps of songs like 'Khalibali' from 'Padmaavat', 'Tattad Tattad' from 'RamLeela' as well as 'Naatu Naatu' from 'RRR'.

340.title: 26 Rohingyas including 12 children detained in Assam
340.article_body: A total of 26 Rohingyas, including 12 children, have been detained by police from Silchar in Assam's Cachar on Sunday. District SP Ramandeep Kaur said that the Rohingyas are Myanmar nationals and didn't have "many documents". "The Rohingyas reached...Kamakhya railway station in Guwahati on Saturday night and travelled to Silchar by road. They were coming from Jammu," the SP added.

341.title: I want to do disruptive content that changes storytelling: Tahir
341.article_body: Actor Tahir Raj Bhasin has stated in an interview that he wants to do "disruptive content" that changes what the notion of storytelling is. The actor further said that he has always received offers for portraying a masala hero but his selection depends on the kind of scripts that he wants to do in the moment.

342.title: If Buttler fires again, then that's it: Aakash on RR-GT IPL 2022 final
342.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra has said if RR opener Jos Buttler, who's currently the leading run-scorer of IPL 2022, "fires again" in the final against GT on Sunday, then "the boss will play, then that's it". Aakash added, "Jaiswal is playing those explosive knocks...Devdutt Padikkal is a very important player, especially if they are batting first...[RR's] bowling is going very [well]."

343.title: Optimistic about Jos Buttler returning to England Test side: McCullum
343.article_body: England's newly-appointed red-ball coach Brendon McCullum has said that he is optimistic about wicketkeeper-batter Jos Buttler returning to the English Test team. "Jos is one...you...think how could he be so dominant in one form (and not in Test cricket)," McCullum said. "There's no reason why, if you're good at T20, you can't bring those skills into Test cricket," he added.

344.title: Supporters of Oppn parties will vote for me: Dhami on Champawat bypoll
344.article_body: Ahead of the Assembly bypoll for the Champawat seat, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Sunday said that even supporters of Opposition parties will give their votes to him. "It's not even a party poll now. Some people were from BSP, SP, Congress and AAP, everyone's now saying that they'll give their vote to me," Dhami added.

345.title: Bicycle thief arrested in B'luru, 54 bicycles worth ₹6 lakh recovered
345.article_body: Bengaluru Police have arrested a man, Balraj, for stealing bicycles and recovered 54 bicycles, worth ₹6 lakh from him. Police said that some of the bicycles that Balraj stole cost ₹60,000. Balraj used to sell these bicycles for ₹3,000-4,000, police said, adding that they are yet to find owners of recovered bicycles as many did not file any complaint.

346.title: J&K LG meets family of TV artiste Amreen Bhat killed by terrorists
346.article_body: Lieutenant Governor of Jammu and Kashmir Manoj Sinha on Sunday met the family members of 35-year-old TV artiste Amreen Bhat, who was shot dead by terrorists. "She was a strong-willed woman and a pillar of support to her family. The administration will provide every possible assistance...to the family. We shall forever remember Amreen's indomitable spirit," Office of LG J&K tweeted.

347.title: Worried over loan repayment, Mumbai constable dies by suicide
347.article_body: A 25-year-old constable, Nikhil Gautam Sable, died by suicide in Mumbai's Kanjurmarg suburb, an official said on Saturday. "He had reportedly taken loans from two prominent private banks, including one which was of ₹2 lakh. He was depressed over repayment," the official added. Sable was found hanging from the ceiling of his home, the official further said.

348.title: Johny Lever celebrates 38th wedding anniversary with Sujatha, shares video
348.article_body: Johny Lever took to Instagram on Saturday to share a video of him clicking a selfie with his wife Sujatha Lever on their 38th wedding anniversary. He wrote, "38 years hogaye shadi ko, ho jaaye ek gulabi selfie (It's been 38 years since our wedding, let's click...pink selfie)." Reacting to Johny's post, a fan wrote, "They look so cute together."

349.title: Children of poor will also become engineers, doctors: Kejriwal in H'yana
349.article_body: Ahead of civic polls, AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said if given a chance, his party will improve the condition of all schools in Haryana. "Children of poor will also become engineers and doctors," Kejriwal added while addressing a rally in Haryana. "We didn't allow private schools of Delhi to increase their fee in past seven years," Kejriwal stated.

350.title: Jharkhand to get WHO award for controlling tobacco consumption
350.article_body: The WHO has selected Jharkhand for the World No-Tobacco Day Award-2022 after recognising its efforts in controlling tobacco consumption, an official said. "It's a great achievement for Jharkhand, which could be possible only due to political and administrative supports that tobacco control cell has got in implementing the programme," National Tobacco Control Programme's state nodal officer said.

351.title: Kanika Kapoor shares pics from court wedding with Gautam Hathiramani
351.article_body: Singer Kanika Kapoor took to Instagram on Sunday to share pictures from her court wedding with Gautam Hathiramani. One of the pictures showed them holding hands while an officiator stood next to them. They could also be seen signing some documents in one picture. Kanika and Gautam tied the knot as per Hindu traditions on May 20 in London.

352.title: Mbappe is already forgotten: Real Madrid president after Champions League win
