352.article_body: Real Madrid president Florentino Perez has said Kylian Mbappe is "already forgotten" after his side defeated Liverpool to win the Champions League/European Cup for a record-extending 14th time. Mbappe was reportedly in talks with Madrid to join the club but signed a contract extension until 2025 at PSG. "Madrid will continue to work on having the best players," added Perez.

353.title: Don't know if we're just seeing the tip of the iceberg: WHO on monkeypox surge
353.article_body: WHO addressed the "unusual" spread of monkeypox in non-endemic countries, saying, "We don't know if we are just seeing the peak of the iceberg." WHO official Sylvie Briand said, "We're still at the very, very beginning of this event." She added, "We know we'll have more cases in the coming days." Over 200 cases have been reported so far.

354.title: NSA invoked against jailed SP leader Rizwan Zaheer
354.article_body: The National Security Act has been invoked against jailed SP leader Rizwan Zaheer. The act has been invoked against Zaheer to maintain public peace and order, the Superintendent of Police Rajesh Kumar Saxena said. Notably, Zaheer is in jail for the past five months in connection with the murder of the Tulsipur Nagar Panchayat's former chairman.

355.title: Locals said it crashed in river: Nepal Army on plane carrying 22 people including 4 Indians
355.article_body: Nepal Army spokesperson Narayan Silwal has said that based on the information given by locals, the missing Tara Air plane carrying 22 people, including four Indians, crashed at the mouth of the Lamche river. "Nepal Army is moving towards the site from the ground and air route," he added. The  aircraft lost contact around 10 am on Sunday.

356.title: Warne's RR were only team to come to stadium at 7.25 pm for 8 pm matches: Irfan Pathan
356.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has revealed that Shane Warne-led Rajasthan Royals (RR) were the only team in IPL 2008 to come to the stadium at 7.25 pm for 8 pm matches. Irfan added, "Warne was way ahead of his time. He thought, 'Players will get tired because it's summer season and I won't let that happen. I'll conserve their energy'."

357.title: BJP will make your children goons, rioters and rapists: Kejriwal
357.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal, while addressing a rally in Haryana, said those who want their children to become goons, rioters and rapists should send them to the BJP. "Those who want their children to become doctors, engineers, lawyers, come with us [AAP]," he added. "They'll teach your children to riot and send their children abroad," Kejriwal said.

358.title: Russia won't use tactical nuclear weapons in Ukraine: Russia's UK envoy
358.article_body: Russian Ambassador to the UK Andrei Kelin on Sunday told BBC that he doesn't believe that Moscow would use tactical nuclear weapons in Ukraine. He said that according to Russian military rules, such weapons aren't used in "conflicts like this". Moscow has a "strict provision" for the use of such weapons, mainly when the state's "existence is endangered", he added.

359.title: Putin warns France, Germany against supplying arms to Ukraine
359.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin warned French President Emmanuel Macron and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz against continuing to supply arms to Ukraine. He said it would further destabilise the situation and aggravate the humanitarian crisis. On the other hand, Macron and Scholz called for an immediate ceasefire and asked Putin to talk directly to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

360.title: Alec Baldwin's mother passes away, granddaughter Hailey Bieber pays tribute
360.article_body: Carol Baldwin, the mother of actor Alec Baldwin and grandmother of Hailey Bieber, passed away on May 27 aged 92 in New York. Hailey, daughter of Stephen Baldwin and Kennya Baldwin, took to Instagram to share a post mourning the demise of her grandmother. "Today I celebrate her, the life she lived, and the legacy she leaves behind," she wrote.

361.title: Congress leader booked for cleaning statue of Rajiv Gandhi with his turban
361.article_body: The Joint Co-coordinator of Kisan Congress, Gursimran Singh Mand, has been booked for hurting religious sentiments by cleaning a statue of former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi with his turban in Punjab. In July 2021, Mand had cleaned the statue after two Nihang Sikhs had set the statue on fire. Sikh organisations had raised objections over his move.

362.title: Like Aryan Khan, I'm a victim of made-up case: Jharkhand CM on MGNREGA scam
362.article_body: Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren said that actor Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan was found to be victim of made-up case and that is how he sees the Enforcement Directorate case against himself. The ED is probing a money laundering case related to irregularities in MGNREGA funds disbursement and alleged money laundering in mining lease allocation in Jharkhand.

363.title: German auto company to launch facility in Hyd, employ 3,000 people
363.article_body: A German auto company, ZF, is set to launch its latest facility in Hyderabad's Nanakramguda, Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao confirmed on Friday. The upcoming branch is set to be the company's largest facility among its other branches across 100 locations and 18 major development centres globally, KTR added. The proposed facility will provide employment to 3,000 people.

364.title: Munawar Faruqui's team confirms he will join 'Khatron Ke...': Report
364.article_body: 'Lock Upp' season one winner Munawar Faruqui will reportedly be joining 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12', his team has confirmed. As per a report by News18, his team has confirmed that Munawar will join the 'Khatron Ke Khiladi' team later. This comes amid rumours that Munawar had dropped out of the show. 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12' shoot will begin next month.

365.title: Can't incentivise delivery agents to break traffic rules: Mahua on 10-minute deliveries
365.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra on Sunday tweeted that she will raise the issue of 10-minute deliveries offered by food-ordering apps, in the Parliament. She wrote, "10-minute deliveries need to be regulated or outlawed. No civilised society can be incentivising delivery executives to break traffic rules and put their own and others' lives at risk. All for a quicker pizza."

366.title: Will take back disputed land occupied by India: Nepal PM
366.article_body: Nepal's PM Sher Bahadur Deuba on Saturday said that his government is committed to taking back the "disputed land currently occupied by India". He asserted that Kalapani, Lipulekh and Limpiyadhura are Nepali territories. His statement came after former PM KP Oli criticised the government for failing to take back the "occupied land".

367.title: Fire breaks out in Thane factory, exploding cylinders cause panic
367.article_body: Several commercial establishments, including 13 shops, were damaged after a major fire broke out in a factory manufacturing scientific equipment in Thane's Wagle Estate area on Saturday. The fire was sparked by an LPG cylinder blast in the factory, an official said. Explosions caused by remaining gas cylinders in the factory had caused panic in the locality, eyewitnesses said.

368.title: 25 people missing after cargo boat sinks in Indonesia; 17 rescued
368.article_body: At least 25 people are still missing after a cargo boat carrying about 42 people sank in Makassar Strait in Indonesia, officials said on Sunday. According to South Sulawesi's search and rescue agency head Djunaidi, 17 people have been rescued so far, including those who were found by passing tugboats. The boat reportedly sank due to bad weather.

369.title: I've been impressed but I'd encourage Tilak to not ignore his bowling: Sachin
369.article_body: Talking about MI batter Tilak Varma, Sachin Tendulkar said the 19-year-old is a "promising cricketer who has a fantastic future". Sachin added, "He is fit, quick between the wickets. He even bowls some off-spin. I would encourage Tilak to not ignore his bowling...Overall, I have been impressed with him." Tilak scored 397 runs in 14 games in IPL 2022.

370.title: Debates on Gyanvapi case shouldn't be entertained in modern India: RLD chief
370.article_body: Debates such as those on Gyanvapi case should not be entertained in modern democratic India, RLD chief Jayant Chaudhary said on Sunday. "If you look at it, the law does not allow these sorts of debates (like the ongoing Gyanvapi issue) anymore…Let us not look to create more disturbances for the future using our past as an excuse," Chaudhary added.

371.title: Which are the highest grossing films of 2022 globally so far?
371.article_body: Marvel's 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' is the highest-grossing film of 2022 globally, having earned over $820 million so far. It is followed by 'The Batman', which has earned $769 million. 'The Batman' is followed by 'Water Gate Bridge' (over $626 million) and 'Uncharted' (around $400 million).

372.title: Foetus found growing inside 40-day-old baby in a rare medical condition in Bihar
372.article_body: A foetus was found to be growing inside a 40-day-old baby in Bihar's Motihari in a rare medical condition called 'fetus-in-fetu'. "The infant has undergone surgery and his condition is now stable," Dr Tabrez Aziz of the Rahmania Medical Centre said. The condition has been defined as the presence of one of the twins in the body of the other.

373.title: Know him well, charges are false: Maneka on officer transferred in dog walking row
373.article_body: BJP MP Maneka Gandhi has defended IAS officer Sanjeev Khirwar who was transferred from Delhi for allegedly closing a stadium early to walk his dog. Calling his transfer "wrong", Gandhi said, "I know Khirwar very well. The allegations against him are false." Saying that "Delhi benefitted from his work" in the Environment Department, Maneka called Khirwar's transfer "Delhi's loss".

374.title: Johnny Depp to make comeback with 'Beetlejuice 2': Reports
374.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp will be making a comeback with upcoming film 'Beetlejuice 2' post the defamation trial that he filed against his ex-wife actress Amber Heard, as per reports. Reports state that actors Michael Keaton and Winona Ryder may reprise their roles from the original 1988 film. Johnny's defamation case has been dismissed to be deliberated upon by the jury.

375.title: There's Hindi industry & there's something called AK industry: Sajid on Akshay
375.article_body: Sajid Nadiadwala, who has worked with Akshay Kumar in films like 'Bachchhan Paandey' and 'Housefull', spoke about the actor as he completed 30 years in the film industry. "There's...Telugu industry, Hindi industry and there's something called...AK industry. He's got his industry on his own," he said, adding Akshay "needs immense applause" for the work he has done in the industry.

376.title: Hardik Pandya has poise that is typical of winners: GT team director
376.article_body: GT team director Vikram Solanki, speaking about Hardik Pandya, has said, "Hardik has a poise that is typical of winners." He further called Hardik a passionate cricketer. "He's somebody that has clearly been through a great deal in his life, both as a cricketer and as a person...he uses those experiences to...lead the way he does," Vikram added.

377.title: 4 held for robbing senior citizen of cash, jewellery in Mumbai
377.article_body: A senior citizen was robbed of his cash and jewellery amounting to ₹1.87 lakhs in Mumbai.  The officials of the Mumbai Police have arrested four men for allegedly committing the crime. Notably, the accused disguised as delivery men before allegedly tying the victim at the latter's house, which comes under the jurisdiction of the Malad Police Station, police said.

378.title: No agency can stop work as lord wants it: BJD leader on Puri corridor
378.article_body: Biju Janata Dal leader Pinaki Misra said that no one can stop the ongoing construction work of the heritage corridor in Odisha's Puri as the lord wants it. "The construction work is going on round the clock. It is also the wish of Lord Jagannath that the project work is finished at the earliest," Misra added.

379.title: Kerala man dies of West Nile fever, state Health Department sounds alert
379.article_body: Kerala on Sunday reported the death of a 47-year-old man due to West Nile fever. The disease, which is generally spread by the Culex species of mosquitoes, had earlier claimed a life in Kerala in 2019. The state Health Department has sounded an alert in the wake of the death. Officials said the victim was treated at various hospitals.

380.title: She was outstanding: Harmanpreet on Sophie's last over in Supernova's win
380.article_body: Praising teammate Sophie Ecclestone for her "outstanding" last over which helped Supernovas win against Velocity by four runs in final of Women's T20 Challenge, Supernovas skipper Harmanpreet Kaur said Ecclestone was quite confident. "If you've a bowler who is so confident, half the job is done," she added. With 17 runs needed off the final over, Velocity managed only 12.

381.title: Akshay, Manushi head to Somnath Temple ahead of 'Samrat...' release
381.article_body: Actors Akshay Kumar and Manushi Chhillar along with Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi are headed to Somnath Temple, Varanasi and Rai Pithora ahead of 'Samrat Prithviraj' release. They are also going to plant Samrat Prithviraj Chauhan’s flag at the Rai Pithora fort. "We are...travelling with Samrat Prithviraj's flag...to seek blessings with the flag that represented freedom for our country," Dwivedi said.

382.title: Joined industry 40 yrs ago, I'm full of gratitude that I survived: Archana
382.article_body: Archana Puran Singh said she joined the entertainment industry 40 years ago and had to work extremely hard "as those were times when...industry was quite different from what it is today". "I used to see others who started...with me and were doing extremely well...but today...many of them are nowhere to be found," Archana said, adding, "I'm full of gratitude...I survived."

383.title: Hardik Pandya is knocking on the door of Indian captaincy: Shoaib Akhtar
383.article_body: Talking about GT captain Hardik Pandya's leadership skills, former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said that the all-rounder "is knocking on the door of Indian captaincy". Akhtar added, "Hardik has proved his point (as a leader) but he still needs to focus on his fitness and bowling." Hardik has guided GT to the final in their inaugural IPL season.

384.title: That's on your hands: Man to US lawmaker over Texas shooting
384.article_body: A man confronted US Senator Ted Cruz, who addressed an event of the National Rifles Association, over the shooting at Texas school in which 21 people, including 19 children, died. "Nineteen children died! That's on your hands, Ted Cruz," the man, identified as Benjamin Hernandez, was heard saying in a video that was widely shared.

385.title: Myanmar refugees in B'desh could resort to extremism: Minister
385.article_body: Refugees from Myanmar residing in Bangladesh could resort to extremism, Bangladesh's Foreign Minister AK Abdul Momen said on Saturday. Momen, who was speaking at an event in Guwahati, urged for the refugees' urgent repatriation, adding that several of them were engaging in crimes, including drug and human trafficking. An estimated 1.1 million Rohingya refugees reportedly reside in Bangladesh.

386.title: MI have to lift sixth IPL trophy anyhow: Suryakumar Yadav on IPL 2023
386.article_body: MI batter Suryakumar Yadav, in a video shared by Mumbai Indians' Twitter account, said that his side has to win their sixth IPL trophy by the next season. "It's unfortunate that this can't happen this year, fifth or sixth trophy, but next year, we've to add one more trophy anyhow," he stated. MI finished last on IPL 2022 points table.

387.title: Iranian police use tear gas against building collapse protesters
387.article_body: Iranian police used tear gas and fired shots in the air to disperse people protesting over the collapse of a 10-storey building in Abadan, in which at least 29 people have died, according to local media reports. The protest had turned violent as people forcefully entered the building's ruins while the rescue operations were still on, reported Fars News Agency.

388.title: People said 'We have a bet that you are Kajal bhai': Bhairavi on 'Hum Paanch'
388.article_body: Television actress Bhairavi Raichura who was seen as Kajal Bhai in 'Hum Paanch' said that once she went to play garba during Navratri and people came up to her saying that they have a bet that she is Kajal Bhai. "That's when I felt...that people know me," she said, adding that truck and auto drivers got excited on seeing her.

389.title: Shanghai to ease some COVID curbs to return to normal life: Official
389.article_body: China's Shanghai will ease COVID-19 testing requirements from June 1 for people who want to enter public areas or use the public transport. The adjustments to the testing requirements were made to "resume work and a return to normal life", an official said. However, there will be no change in testing requirements for people leaving the city, the official added.

390.title: They should try Rashid Khan: Manjrekar on GT's bowling plan against Buttler
390.article_body: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said GT should bring in spinner Rashid Khan in the powerplay against RR opener Jos Buttler in the IPL 2022 final on Sunday. "Rashid bowls stump to stump. Whenever Buttler has been in trouble, it has been with that line," explained Manjrekar. Buttler is currently the leading run-getter of IPL 2022 with 824 runs.

391.title: Zoho CEO encouraging youth: PM as he lauds his push for rural entrepreneurship
391.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded Zoho CEO and Padma Shri awardee Sridhar Vembu for his push for rural entrepreneurship and called him a "successful entrepreneur". "He has...taken up upon himself the task of grooming other entrepreneurs...He's encouraging rural youth to do something in this area, staying in the village itself," PM said during the latest episode of 'Mann Ki Baat'.

392.title: Hyderabad Police receive funds for families of deceased officials
392.article_body: Rachakonda Security Council (RKSC), a non-profit society, contributed funds worth ₹8 lakh to Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Saturday. A cheque of ₹5 lakh was donated towards a welfare fund for families of those police officials who had died in the line of duty. An additional ₹3 lakh was donated towards police's free pre-recruitment training initiative aimed at helping police aspirants.

393.title: Student activist accused of sexually harassing woman in JNU campus
393.article_body: An All India Students Association (AISA) activist has been accused of sexually harassing a woman inside the Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) campus in Delhi. According to a statement issued by the Concerned Women of JNU, the woman was inappropriately touched by the accused without her consent. AISA said the complaint has been forwarded to its Gender Sensitisation Committee for enquiry.

394.title: Govt withdraws advisory warning people against sharing photocopy of Aadhaar
394.article_body: The Centre on Sunday withdrew its press note advising people against sharing details and photocopies of their Aadhaar card with any organisation to avoid misuse. Stating that the advisory was issued by UIDAI's Bengaluru office, the government said, "In view of the possibility of the misinterpretation of the Press Release, the same stands withdrawn with immediate effect."

395.title: ONGC becomes India's 2nd most profitable firm after its record net profit in FY22
395.article_body: ONGC reported a net profit of ₹40,305 crore in the fiscal year that ended March 31, becoming India's second most profitable company after Reliance Industries. ONGC's net profit for FY22 surged 258% from ₹11,246.44 crore in FY21. The company replaced Tata Steel from the number two spot, which had reported a standalone net profit of ₹33,011.18 crore for FY22.

396.title: RR should get 24-26 runs off Rashid: Vettori ahead of IPL 2022 final
396.article_body: Ahead of the IPL 2022 final, Daniel Vettori said RR should be looking to score "24-26 runs" in GT spinner Rashid Khan's four-over spell. "Letting him go for 0 for 15 in four overs...sets up...rest of the bowlers," he stated. "I understand you want to restrict wickets, but in this game, runs are going to be...important," he added.

397.title: 7 killed, 9 injured as tourist bus collides with truck on UP highway
397.article_body: Seven persons were killed and nine others were seriously injured when a tourist bus collided with a truck on the Bahraich-Lakhimpur highway in Uttar Pradesh on Sunday, police said. The truck driver managed to escape, ASP Ashok Kumar said. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has condoled the deaths and directed officials concerned to ensure that the injured get good medical treatment.

398.title: Mumbai Police fly to UP to catch murder accused, find him in train’s toilet
398.article_body: A Mumbai Police team that was sent to Uttar Pradesh to catch a man, Ansar Ali Hifazat Ali alias Samir, who had allegedly killed his wife in Goregaon, found the accused hiding in toilet of sleeper train in Prayagraj. The police team was sent by flight because catching accused in running train was difficult. Ansar has been arrested.

399.title: Asked China to review policies impacting Uyghurs: UN rights chief
399.article_body: UN human rights chief Michelle Bachelet, who just visited China, said she has asked the country to review its policies concerning rights of Uyghur Muslims. "I have raised questions and concerns about the application of counter-terrorism and deradicalisation measures under broad application, particularly the impact on the rights of Uyghurs and other predominantly Muslim minorities," she said.

400.title: How much prize money will IPL 2022 winners, runners-up get?
400.article_body: The winners of the IPL 2022 final between Rajasthan Royals and Gujarat Titans will get a prize money of ₹20 crore. This season's runners-up will receive ₹13 crore, while the Most Valuable Player will be awarded ₹12 lakh. The tournament's highest wicket-taker and highest run-scorer will also get ₹15 lakh each.
